example_texts: The clusterin gene CLU contains several variants including rs11136000 that are linked to Alzheimer disease susceptibility. Clusterin influences amyloid-beta clearance and aggregation.
The protein tyrosine kinase PTK2B contains variant rs28834970 linked to cognitive decline and Alzheimer disease. PTK2B regulates calcium signaling in neurons.
MEF2C transcription factor variants including rs190982 are linked to Alzheimer disease and regulate neuronal survival and synaptic function genes.
Loss-of-function variants in ABCA7, including rs3764650, increase AD susceptibility. ABCA7 regulates lipid homeostasis and affects amyloid processing in the brain.
Large-scale genome-wide association study meta-analysis identified 29 risk loci for Alzheimer disease including ZCWPW1, ADAMTS1, and HESX1 variants at genome-wide significance.
Major histocompatibility complex variants in HLA-DRB1 including rs9271192 are associated with AD risk and influence immune responses to amyloid pathology.
Variants in the complement receptor 1 gene CR1, particularly rs6656401, contribute to AD risk through altered complement cascade regulation and amyloid clearance mechanisms.
The immune-related phosphatase gene INPP5D harbors rs35349669 which modulates microglial responses and contributes to AD pathogenesis.
The FERMT2 gene variant rs17125944 modulates integrin signaling pathways and contributes to Alzheimer disease susceptibility through blood-brain barrier dysfunction.
The PICALM gene variant rs3851179 affects clathrin-mediated endocytosis and is associated with reduced Alzheimer disease risk. PICALM influences APP processing and amyloid-beta production.
Variants in SORL1 such as rs11218343 influence APP trafficking and processing. SORL1 dysfunction leads to increased amyloid-beta production and Alzheimer disease risk.
ADAM10 is the major alpha-secretase for APP. Variants such as rs593742 that enhance ADAM10 activity reduce amyloid-beta production and AD risk.

The rs429358 variant in the APOE gene is strongly associated with increased Alzheimer disease risk across multiple populations. This variant increases disease risk by approximately 3-fold in heterozygotes and 15-fold in homozygotes.

Rare coding variants in TREM2, including rs75932628, significantly affect microglial function and increase risk for late-onset Alzheimer disease. The R47H variant increases AD risk approximately 3-fold.
Common variants near BIN1 at rs744373 are associated with Alzheimer disease risk. BIN1 variants modulate tau pathology and affect endosomal trafficking in neurons.
